SEARCH
Package model

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
model.GameBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameBoard extends Object implements Serializable
GameBoard This class represents the game board. The game board is a hexagonal grid of tiles. It has a layout, a grid size, a set of tiles, a set of vertices, a set of edges, a thief, and a thief mode. The layout is the layout of the grid. The grid size is the size of the grid. The set of tiles is the set of tiles in the grid. The set of vertices is the set of vertices in the grid. The set of edges is the set of edges in the grid. The thief is the thief that is on the board. The thief mode is a boolean that indicates if the game is in thief mode.
See Also:

    • getNeighbourTileVerticesToVertex

      public TileVertex[] getNeighbourTileVerticesToVertex(TileVertex vertex)
      . getNeighbourTileVerticesToVertex
      Parameters:
      vertex - this methods goes through the edges of the board. once it finds the edges that contain the vertex on one of their ends, it adds them to an arraylist. then it goes through the arraylist and adds the other vertex for every edge to another arraylist. it returns the arraylist of vertices.
      Returns:
      the three tile vertices that are closest to the given vertex the three tile vertices are the ones that are connected to the given vertex by an edge the three tile vertices are returned in an array

    • checkIfNeighbourInArray

      public boolean checkIfNeighbourInArray(TileVertex[] neighbours, TileVertex vertex)
      . checkIfNeighbourInArray
      Parameters:
      neighbours -
      vertex -
      Returns:
      true if the vertex is in the array of neighbours, false otherwise this method is to check so that we don't add the same vertex to the array of neighbours multiple times

    • checkIfNeighbourInArray

      public boolean checkIfNeighbourInArray(TileEdge[] neighbours, TileEdge edge)
      . checkIfNeighbourInArray (overloaded method)
      Parameters:
      neighbours -
      edge -
      Returns:
      true if the edge is in the array of neighbours, false otherwise this method is to check so that we don't add the same edge to the array of neighbours multiple times

    • getNeighbourTileVerticesToEdge

      public TileVertex[] getNeighbourTileVerticesToEdge(TileEdge edge)
      . getNeighbourTileVerticesToEdge
      Parameters:
      edge -
      Returns:
      the two tile vertices that are connected to the edge that's basically used to find the two tile vertices that have the same coordinates as the start and end of the edge the two tile vertices are returned in an array

    • getNeighbourTileEdgesToEdge

      public TileEdge[] getNeighbourTileEdgesToEdge(TileEdge edge)
      . getNeighbourTileEdgesToEdge
      Parameters:
      edge - this method goes through the edges of the board. once it finds the edges that are connected to the given edge, it adds them to an arraylist. it returns the arraylist of edges.
      Returns:
      the four tile edges that are connected to the given edge the four tile edges are the ones that are connected to the given edge by a vertex the four tile edges are returned in an array

    • getNeighbourTileEdgesToVertex

      public TileEdge[] getNeighbourTileEdgesToVertex(TileVertex vertex)
      . getNeighbourTileEdgesToVertex
      Parameters:
      vertex - This method goes through the edges of the board. once it finds the edges that contain the vertex on one of their ends, -it adds them to an arraylist. -it returns the arraylist of edges.
      Returns:
      the three tile edges that are closest to the given vertex the three tile edges are the ones that are connected to the given vertex by a vertex the three tile edges are returned in an array

    • isVertexTwoRoadsAwayFromCities

      public boolean isVertexTwoRoadsAwayFromCities(TileVertex vertex)
      . isVertexTwoRoadsAwayFromCities
      Parameters:
      vertex - this method goes through the edges of the board. once it finds the edges that contain the vertex on one of their ends, it adds them to an arraylist. then it goes through the arraylist and checks if the vertex is two roads away from cities. basically, if a vertex one road away from a city contains a building, then the vertex is not two roads away from cities.
      Returns:
      true if the vertex is two roads away from cities, false otherwise that's used to check if a player can place a colony on a vertex. In the game, a player can only place a colony on a vertex if it is two roads away from cities.
      See Also:
      • to see how the vertices are found.

    • isRoadNextToCity

      public boolean isRoadNextToCity(TileEdge edge, Player player)
      . isRoadNextToCity
      Parameters:
      edge -
      player - this method goes through the vertices of the board. once it finds the vertices that are connected to the edge, it checks if the vertex contains a building. if the vertex contains a building, then it checks if the building belongs to the player.
      Returns:
      true if the road is next to a city that belongs to the player, false otherwise that's used to check if a player can place a road on an edge. In the game, a player can only place a road on an edge if it is next to a city that belongs to the player. that's also used to check if a player can place a road on an edge if it is next to a road that belongs to the player. That rule is always true except for the first two roads that the player places.
      See Also:
      • to see how the vertices are found.

    • isRoadNextToVertex

      public boolean isRoadNextToVertex(TileEdge edge, TileVertex vertex)
      . isRoadNextToVertex
      Parameters:
      edge -
      vertex - this method goes through the vertices of the board. once it finds the vertices that are connected to the edge, it checks if the vertex is the same as the given vertex.
      Returns:
      true if the road is next to the given vertex, false otherwise that's used to check if a player can place a city on a vertex. In the game, a player can only place a city or colony on a vertex if it is next to a road that belongs to the player. The only exception is when the player places the first two roads and colonies.
      See Also:
      • to see how the vertices are found.

    • isRoadNextToRoad

      public boolean isRoadNextToRoad(TileEdge edge, Player player)
      . isRoadNextToRoad
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge that is checked if it is next to a road
      player - the player that is checked if the road belongs to him this method goes through the edges of the board. it then checks if the edge contains a building. if the edge contains a building, then it checks if the building belongs to the player.
      Returns:
      true if the road is next to a road that belongs to the player, false otherwise that's used to check if a player can place a road on an edge. In the game, a player can only place a road on an edge if it is next to a road or a colony that belongs to the player. this method in particular is used to check if a player can place a road on an edge if it is next to a road that belongs to the player.
      See Also:
      • to see how the edges are found.

    • isVertexNextToRoad

      public boolean isVertexNextToRoad(TileVertex vertex, Player player)
      . isVertexNextToRoad
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex that is checked if it is next to a road
      player - the player that is checked if the road belongs to him this method goes through the edges of the board. once it finds the edges that are connected to the vertex, it checks if the edge contains a building. if the edge contains a building, then it checks if the building belongs to the player.
      Returns:
      true if the vertex is next to a road that belongs to the player, false otherwise that's used to check if a player can place a colony on a vertex. In the game, a player can only place a colony on a vertex if it is next to a road that belongs to the player. that's also used to check if a player can place a colony on a vertex if it is next to a city that belongs to the player.
      See Also:
      • to see how the edges are found.

    • canPlaceColony

      public boolean canPlaceColony(TileVertex vertex, Player player)
      . canPlaceColony
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex where the player wants to place a colony
      player - the player that wants to place a colony
      Returns:
      true if the player can place a colony on the vertex, false otherwise that's used to check if a player can place a colony on a vertex. it also checks if the player is allowed to place a colony for free. it's also checking if the vertex already contains a building. In the game, a player can only place a colony on a vertex if: it is two roads away from cities, and next to a road that belongs to the player (except for the first two roads and colonies).
      See Also:
      • to see how the vertex is checked if it is two roads away from cities.
      • to see how the vertex is checked if it is next to a road that belongs to the player.

    • canPlaceCity

      public boolean canPlaceCity(TileVertex vertex, Player player)
      . canPlaceCity
      Parameters:
      vertex -
      player - it's used to check if we have the conditions to place a city
      Returns:
      true if we can, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • to see how we create cities or colonies

    • canPlaceRoad

      public boolean canPlaceRoad(TileEdge edge, Player player)
      . canPlaceRoad
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge where the player wants to place a road
      player - the player that wants to place a road
      Returns:
      true if the player can place a road on the edge, false otherwise that's used to check if a player can place a road on an edge. it also checks if the player is allowed to place a road for free. it's also checking if the edge already contains a building. In the game, a player can only place a road on an edge if: it is next to a city that belongs to the player, or next to a road that belongs to the player (except for the first two roads).
      See Also:
      • to see how the edge is checked if it is next to a city that belongs to the player.
      • to see how the edge is checked if it is next to a road that belongs to the player.

    • addTile

      public void addTile(int q, int r, int diceValue, TileType resourceType)
      . addTile
      Parameters:
      q - the first coordinate of the tile
      r - the second coordinate of the tile
      diceValue - the dice value of the tile
      resourceType - the resource type of the tile this method adds a tile to the board. it creates a tile with the given q, r, dice value, and resource type. it then adds the tile to the board. if the resource type is desert, then the thief is set to the tile.
      See Also:
      • to see how the resource type is converted to a tile type.
      • to see how the thief is set to the tile.
      • to see how the tile is created.
      • to see how the tile is added to the board.

    • getBoard

      public LinkedHashMap<CubeCoordinates,Tile> getBoard()

    • initialiseBoard

      public void initialiseBoard()
      initialiseBoard this method initialises the board. it goes through the grid size and creates tiles for each q, r, s coordinates. it then adds the tiles to the board. it also sets the dice value and resource type for each tile. the dice value and resource type are set based on the preset tile dice values and tile resource types. the preset tile dice values and tile resource types are constants.
      See Also:
      • to see the preset tile dice values.
      • to see the preset tile resource types.
      • to see how the tiles are added to the board.
      • to see how the resource type is converted to a tile type.
      • to see how the tile is created.
      • to see how the tile is added to the board.

    • edgesMapContainsEdge

      public boolean edgesMapContainsEdge(TileEdge edge)
      . edgesMapContainsEdge
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge we want to check if it is in the map
      Returns:
      true if the edge is already in the map, false otherwise this method checks if the given edge is already in the map. that's used to avoid adding the same edge multiple times to the map.

    • drawImagesInHexes

      public void drawImagesInHexes(Graphics g)
      . drawImagesInHexes
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object this method draws the images in the hexes. it goes through the tiles of the board. for each tile, it gets the pixel coordinates of the tile. it then draws the image of the tile on the pixel coordinates. if the game is in thief mode, then the image of the selected tile is highlighted.

      . drawPorts
      Parameters:

    • mouseMoved

      public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e)
      . mouseMoved
      Parameters:
      e - the mouse event this method is called when the mouse is moved. it gets the mouse position. it then finds the closest vertex and the closest edge to the mouse position. if the game is in thief mode, then the tile that is closest to the mouse position is highlighted.
      See Also:
      • to see how the closest vertex is found.
      • to see how the closest edge is found.
      • to see how the thief is changed.

    • findClosestEdge

      public TileEdge findClosestEdge()
      . findClosestEdge
      Returns:
      the closest edge to the mouse position this method finds the closest edge to the mouse position. it goes through the edges of the board. for each edge, it calculates the distance between the edge and the mouse position. if the distance is less than the minimum distance to the edge, then the minimum distance to the edge is updated. the closest edge is then updated.
      See Also:
      • to see the class that represents the edge.
      • to see the class that represents the coordinates.

    • findClosestVertex

      public TileVertex findClosestVertex()
      . findClosestVertex
      Returns:
      the closest vertex to the mouse position this method finds the closest vertex to the mouse position. it goes through the vertices of the board. for each vertex, it calculates the distance between the vertex and the mouse position. if the distance is less than the minimum distance to the vertex, then the minimum distance to the vertex is updated. the closest vertex is then updated.
      See Also:
      • to see the class that represents the vertex.
      • to see the class that represents the coordinates.

    • initialiseBoardAfterTransfer

      public void initialiseBoardAfterTransfer()

    • initialiseLayout

      public void initialiseLayout()
      . initialiseLayout this method initialises the layout of the board. it creates a layout with the pointy orientation and the point1 and point2 coordinates. the point1 and point2 coordinates are scaled based on the game width and height.
      See Also:
      • to see how the game width and height are used to scale the coordinates.
      • to see how the layout is created.
      • to see how the coordinates are scaled.
      • to see the pointy orientation.
